Title: Senior Insight Analyst UK
Description:
Company Description

We’re ASOS, the online retailer for fashion lovers all around the world.

We exist to give our customers the confidence to be whoever they want to be, and that goes for our people too. At ASOS, you’re free to be your true self without judgement, and channel your creativity into a platform used by millions.

But how are we showing up? We’re proud members of Inclusive Companies, are Disability Confident Committed and have signed the Business in the Community Race at Work Charter and we placed 8th in the Inclusive Top 50 Companies Employer list.

Everyone needs some help showing up as their best self. Let our Talent team know if you need any adjustments throughout the process in whatever way works best for you.

Job Description

We're looking for a strategic, commercially-minded Insight Analyst to drive ASOS’ business in the UK through uncovering high value insights about our customers, their behaviours and preferences, leveraging data to understand key drivers of business performance and profitability, and continually measuring the impact of initiatives to steer investment decisions.

You'll be flexing your analytical skills to uncover actionable insights spanning a range of functions, working and collaborating directly with senior stakeholders. The ideal candidate will be innately curious, have a strong business acumen, a robust technical toolkit and a passion for fashion.

This is a high impact role where your insights will directly influence and contribute to ASOS' success. You're not just in the driver's seat; you're the engine propelling us towards achieving our growth ambition. If you're the kind of analytical powerhouse who enjoys cracking tough problems and crafting ingenious solutions, this is where you belong.

The Details


Combine market, customer, marketing and assortment insights to drive a holistic picture of performance, proactively communicating key trends and opportunities to senior leadership
Complete exploratory data analysis and statistical modelling (e.g., regression analysis, clustering techniques) to propose innovative solutions on topics such as customer and product segmentations to help determine high impact actions and strategies
Dive deep into customer data to gain a profound understanding of our audience, and use these insights to drive improvements in our marketing strategy, experience & offering
Identify trends in performance, investigate drivers, and present findings to diverse stakeholders, articulating the “so what” by translating insights into strategic, actionable recommendations
Develop methodologies to measure the impact of initiatives and tests across our site, marketing, price/promo, product assortment, delivery proposition, and other areas affecting our customer journey and operations
Develop key metrics and dashboards to monitor business health, measure success and support strategic initiatives
Identify business growth opportunities based on customer insights and market trends
Independently plan and prioritise work based on market strategy and priorities



Qualifications

About You


Previous experience working in Data Analytics/Insights
A data enthusiast who enjoys immersing yourself in data to solve business problems and present compelling stories that drive change
Experience in mining and analysing large data sets, with proficiency in using data and statistical analysis tools to query datasets and drive end-to-end complete analysis that helps accelerate the business
Experience using data to create compelling stories that communicate key messages across the organisation and to influence various levels of management decision making
Commercial mindset, with a strong understanding of how data insights can drive business impact and profitability
An obsession with the customer and ability to analyse trends and data through the customer lens
A collaborate approach and ability to operate as an analytical thought partner who can translate business questions into data analysis visions to execute
Strong communication skills, comfortable presenting data to groups of stakeholders in a way that is effective and concise
The ability to break down complex problems into smaller ones
An interest in the 20-something customer and fashion industry
E-commerce work experience (desirable)
Strong background / education in a quantitative or business discipline (desirable)



We believe being together in person helps us move faster, connect more deeply, and achieve more as a team. That’s why our approach to working together includes spending at least 3 days a week in the office. It’s a rhythm that speeds up decision-making, helps ASOSers learn from each other more quickly, and builds the kind of culture where people can grow, create, and succeed.

Additional Information

BeneFITS’


Employee discount (hello ASOS discount!)
Employee sample sales
25 days paid annual leave + an extra celebration day for a special moment
Private medical care scheme
Fixed Annual Payment in addition to your salary each year, it's just an extra thank you from us
Opportunity for personalised learning and in-the-moment experiences that enable you to thrive and excel in your role.



Why take our word for it? Search #InsideASOS on our socials to see what life at ASOS is like.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Belfast Hybrid




We are proud to be partnering exclusively with a leading cybersecurity vendor to recruit for a Data Analyst. This is an exciting opportunity to use data-driven insights to enhance customer success and overall business performance within a fast-growing, innovative environment.

Role Responsibilities:

Analyse and interpret complex datasets to deliver clear, actionable insights that drive strategic decisions.
Design, build, and maintain dashboards and reports using tools such as Tableau or Power BI.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify trends, predict churn, and drive customer retention and growth.
Ensure data accuracy, quality, and consistency across systems, including Salesforce and other Customer Success tools.
Contribute to AI, automation, and analytics initiatives that improve product performance and customer outcomes.




Experience & Skills Required

2–4+ years of experience in a data analytics or business intelligence role, ideally within a technology or SaaS environment.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with proficiency in Python or similar scripting languages.
Advanced experience with data visualization tools (Tableau, Power BI) and CRM systems.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to present insights clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Bachelor’s degree in Data, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field (or equivalent experience).




Why Apply?

Join a world-class cybersecurity organization that values innovation, collaboration, and continuous learning.




Enjoy a hybrid working model (3 days per week onsite in Belfast) and the opportunity to make a measurable impact through data-driven decision-making

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Ready for a new challenge?

Are you looking for work that makes a difference? Do you want to collaborate with people who learn and grow together?




If so, this opportunity could be the right fit for you. We're a growing technology consultancy that delivers user-centred solutions with purpose, partnering with clients across government and commercial sectors.




The Role

You’ll support clients in improving their services by selecting appropriate techniques to turn data into insights. Working as part of a product delivery team, you’ll help develop performance-measuring frameworks to track goals, user needs, or KPIs. You will operate within the client’s requirements and comply with relevant legal, technical, and ethical standards.




As a senior member of the team, you’ll mentor junior colleagues, provide constructive feedback, and demonstrate an understanding of each product delivery phase, applying suitable measurement techniques throughout.




You’ll also be expected to ensure work aligns with relevant quality, environmental, and information security standards and any applicable client policies or procedures.




Essential Experience

Proficiency in scripting and programming languages (e.g. SQL, Python, R)
Experience visualising data using tools such as Power BI, Tableau, QlikView, Power Query, or similar
Designing and implementing performance frameworks including KPIs or OKRs
Strong analytical skills to identify, validate, and interpret data from the right sources
Experience collecting, collating, cleansing, and interpreting data to extract actionable insights
Ability to use appropriate data visualisation techniques to communicate insights effectively
Formulating and testing hypotheses to generate evidence-based insights
Possession of (or eligibility for) Security Clearance




Desirable Experience

Understanding of security and data privacy best practices
Making data-informed recommendations for service or product changes
Familiarity with government or healthcare design principles (e.g. GDS, NHS)




Salary

£45,000–£50,000 per annum




What’s on Offer

Competitive pension scheme, health cash plan, share options, and discretionary bonus
Flexible working hours and 25 days’ holiday
A supportive team environment that helps you grow




Location & Ways of Working

This role involves hybrid working across a mix of client sites, hub locations, and remote/home working. Some travel may be required depending on client and project needs.




Inclusion & Accessibility

We welcome applicants from all backgrounds, identities, and perspectives. Our goal is to reflect the diversity of society in the work we do and the impact we make.




Interviews are held via Microsoft Teams, and reasonable adjustments can be made upon request.




Interested?

For more information hit apply!

Essential Experience

  • Proficiency in scripting and programming languages (e.g. SQL, Python, R)
  • Experience visualising data using tools such as Power BI, Tableau, QlikView, Power Query, or similar
  • Designing and implementing performance frameworks including KPIs or OKRs
  • Strong analytical skills to identify, validate, and interpret data from the right sources
  • Experience collecting, collating, cleansing, and interpreting data to extract actionable insights
  • Ability to use appropriate data visualisation techniques to communicate insights effectively
  • Formulating and testing hypotheses to generate evidence-based insights
  • Possession of (or eligibility for) Security Clearance


Desirable Experience

  • Understanding of security and data privacy best practices
  • Making data-informed recommendations for service or product changes
  • Familiarity with government or healthcare design principles (e.g. GDS, NHS)


Salary

  • £45,000–£50,000 per annum


What’s on Offer

  • Competitive pension scheme, health cash plan, share options, and discretionary bonus
  • Flexible working hours and 25 days’ holiday
  • A supportive team environment that helps you grow


Location & Ways of Working

This role involves hybrid working across a mix of client sites, hub locations, and remote/home working. Some travel may be required depending on client and project needs.


Inclusion & Accessibility

We welcome applicants from all backgrounds, identities, and perspectives. Our goal is to reflect the diversity of society in the work we do and the impact we make.


Interviews are held via Microsoft Teams, and reasonable adjustments can be made upon request.


Interested?

For more information hit apply!

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
As people increasingly move across channels and platforms, Kantar Media’s data and audience measurement, targeting, analytics and advertising intelligence services unlock insights to inform powerful decision-making.




Working with panel and first-party data in over 80 countries, we have the world’s fastest growing cross-media measurement footprint, underpinned by versatility, scale, technology and expertise, to drive long-term business growth for our clients and partners.




Job Title: Junior Data Analyst

Location: London, Grays Inn Road

Work pattern: Full time/Permanent/Hybrid working




#LI-Hybrid #LI-EH2 #LI-KantarMedia




Role Description:




Reporting to the Barb Research Director, the Dovetail Data Integration Analyst will work to deliver on Barb’s vision of an inclusive, audience-centric TV and video measurement that extends the scope of total viewing across content and advertising.




This role will combine data analysis and understanding of data science methodologies, leading on efforts to enhance our suite of audience reporting, including new Barb Panel Plus initiative which extends existing Dovetail reporting and combines fusion and calibration methodologies. In this role you will work closely with Barb, our stakeholders and data science and data integration teams to create clear briefs with the needs of the end client in mind, and participate in testing and implementation of developments, as well as reviewing test data. You will be involved in presenting data and testing findings to internal and external stakeholders and verifying client satisfaction with the product.




The Dovetail Data Integration Analyst will interface closely with the product teams working on fusion and calibration methodologies. You will work to ensure smooth hand-offs for internal developments and providing an essential quality to ensure the accuracy and reliability of the service.




Key Responsibilities

Collaborating with stakeholders to identify new opportunities and working with internal teams to drive continuous improvement
Analyse, organize and present audience data in a clear and intuitive way, to derive actionable insights and recommendations
Prepare and present research findings, insights, and recommendations to key stakeholders and leadership teams.
Collaborate closely with data science, data integration, data operations and other stakeholders to develop specifications that have the end data user in mind
Serve as a subject matter expert on the Dovetail/Panel Plus file specifications and calculation methodologies, responding to internal and external queries
Establish a close and productive working relationship with the Barb executive and stakeholders, becoming a trusted advisor on audience measurement




Skills & Experience

The ideal candidate will be able to demonstrate:




Experience with multiple types of data – panel data, census data
Experience and proficiency in the following:
Database management proficiency / SQL
Python (specifically for data analysis)
Data visualisation (Power BI)
Microsoft Office suite (Excel / PowerPoint)
Familiarity with cloud data platforms (Data Bricks, Snowflake)
Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to control communication flows; Client facing experience is an advantage.
Numerate and analytical, comfortable with advanced mathematical and statistical concepts, with some understanding of marketing science analytics
Experience of data analysis/and or analysing large datasets, Developer Skills are advantage
Quick learner & self-starter who can use technical Forums when stuck with issues and willingness in investing time & effort to understand datasets associated with this domain.




Our offer




At Kantar we have an integrated way of rewarding our people based around a simple, clear, and consistent set of principles. Our approach helps to ensure we are market competitive and to support a pay for performance culture, where your reward and career progression opportunities are linked to what you deliver.




We go beyond the obvious, using intelligence, passion, and creativity to inspire new thinking and shape the world we live in. Apply for a career that’s out of the ordinary and join us.




We want to create an equality of opportunity in a fair and supportive working environment where people feel included, accepted, and are allowed to flourish in a space where their mental health and wellbeing is taken into consideration. We want to create a more diverse community to expand our talent pool, be locally representative, drive diversity of thinking and better commercial outcomes.




At Kantar, the diversity of our employees provides a richer environment for our employees and broader depth and breadth of thinking for our clients. Kantar is committed to inclusion and diversity; therefore, we welcome applications from all sections of society and do not discriminate because of age, race, religion, gender, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, marital status, or any other legally protected characteristics.




Privacy and Legal Statement




PRIVACY DISCLOSURE: Please note that by applying to this opportunity you consent to the personal data you provide to us to be processed and retained by The Kantar Group Limited (“Kantar”). Your details will be kept on our Internal ATS (Applicant Tracking System) for as long as is necessary for the purposes of recruitment, which may include your details being shared with the hiring manager(s) and for consideration for potential future opportunities by Kantar and its affiliate Kantar group companies. For full details of our privacy policy please visit www.kantar.com

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Remote (UK-based) | 12 Months | Outside IR35 | Day Rate: DOE

Chapman Tate is looking for an experienced Data Analyst with a strong background in the transportation and logistics sector to join a high-impact, fast-paced contract engagement. This role is ideal for someone who can bring deep industry insight into logistics data, operations, and performance reporting.

Overview

You’ll be supporting a strategic data initiative focused on improving supply chain visibility, fleet performance, and operational decision-making. You will work closely with cross-functional teams, using data to drive business-critical insights and actionable recommendations.




Must-Have Experience

Proven experience as a Data Analyst in transportation, logistics, freight.
Strong skills in Power BI, SQL, Excel, and at least one scripting language (e.g. Python or R)
Experience working with datasets from WMS, TMS, ERP, or fleet management systems
Strong communication skills and ability to explain complex data clearly
Comfortable working independently in a remote-first environment




Key Responsibilities

Develop dashboards and reports to monitor KPIs across transportation, warehousing, and fleet operations
Clean, model, and analyse logistics data (e.g. routing, deliveries, delays, fuel usage, etc.)
Support decision-making through actionable insights and data storytelling
Collaborate with business stakeholders to gather reporting requirements
Identify data quality issues and recommend solutions
Present findings to senior management and non-technical audiences




How to apply?

To express your interest in this opportunity and to understand further details, please share your CV via the link.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Who we are

Our vision is simple: a global financial system, without hidden fees or unfair FX rates. With control in the hands of the users instead of the hands of banks. With fund management capabilities to grow your savings for decades and build generational wealth.




What we’re looking for

Are you curious about how things work and motivated by uncovering insights hidden in data?

As a Data Analyst at DolarApp, you’ll help us understand our business, customers, and operations through rigorous analysis and thoughtful storytelling. You’ll explore data, detect patterns, and build the foundations for decisions that shape the future of our products and company.

This is a role for someone early in their analytics career who wants to grow — learning how data drives product, financial, and strategic decisions in a fast-paced fintech environment.




What you’ll be doing

Explore and Analyze Data: Investigate user behaviour, performance trends, and key metrics to uncover what’s driving changes.
Identify Anomalies and Opportunities: Spot unusual patterns or spikes and help the team understand their root causes.
Reporting & Automation: Build and maintain dashboards and automated reports that make data accessible and reliable.
Decision Support: Translate analytical findings into clear recommendations for product and operational improvements.
Metric Design: Help define and refine the KPIs that matter most for our business and customer experience.
Documentation: Keep analyses, methodologies, and assumptions well-documented and reproducible.
Modelling & Experimentation: Contribute to basic modeling tasks and structured experiments under guidance from senior analysts or data scientists.
Continuous Learning: Expand your analytical toolkit and develop product sense through real-world problem solving and mentorship.




What you’ll need

1–3 years of experience in analytics, data, or operations (internships count)
Strong SQL skills for querying and exploring datasets
Analytical curiosity and a structured approach to problem solving
Good communication skills — able to explain insights clearly and visually
Initiative to automate repetitive tasks and improve reporting workflows
Interest in fintech, data-driven decision-making, and machine learning concepts
(Bonus) Familiarity with Python for basic data manipulation
(Bonus) Spanish/Portuguese proficiency for internal and external communications




Nice to have

Experience with BI or visualization tools (Metabase, Looker, Power BI, etc.)
Understanding of key business metrics and experimentation principles
Exposure to fraud, financial, or product analytics (any domain welcome)




Benefits

Competitive salary
Sign-on stock option bonus — be part of DolarApp’s growth
Discretionary performance bonus (stock options)
Paid annual leave
Latest technology and tools to work with
Ownership and autonomy from day one
A collaborative, talented team that helps you grow

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Customer Intelligence Analyst – Global Cybersecurity Leader | Belfast (Hybrid)

Are you ready to use data to shape customer success in a world-leading cybersecurity organisation?

Do you want to join a team at the forefront of protecting digital interactions for governments and enterprises worldwide?

My client, a global leader in identity management and data protection, is seeking a Customer Intelligence Analyst to join their growing Belfast operation. This is an exciting opportunity to make a tangible impact by turning data into actionable insights that enhance customer experience, retention, and product innovation across a global platform.




What You’ll Be Doing

Researching, developing, and operationalising customer intelligence to drive meaningful business outcomes.
Conducting data analysis on customer and product usage to uncover insights that improve retention, predict churn, and elevate customer experience.
Designing and maintaining operational processes for Customer Success teams, ensuring continuous improvement and scalability.
Translating analytical findings into clear, actionable recommendations and presenting them to business leaders.
Administering and optimising Customer Success tools such as Salesforce, and other CRM platforms.
Collaborating cross-functionally with Product, Customer Success, and Data teams to define analytics needs and execute high-impact projects.
Supporting system integration and data ingestion activities while maintaining data quality and accuracy.




Tech Stack & Environment

Analytics & BI: Tableau, Power BI
Languages: Python (or similar scripting language)
CRM & Platforms: Salesforce, (or other Customer Success tools)
Practices: Data-driven decision-making, process optimisation, cross-functional collaboration




About You

3–5+ years of experience in data analytics, customer intelligence, or business analytics roles.
Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Data Science, Computer Science, or a related field (or equivalent experience).
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with proven ability to interpret data and communicate insights effectively.
Experience working cross-functionally and influencing stakeholders in fast-paced environments.
Detail-oriented self-starter with a proactive mindset and excellent communication skills.




What’s On Offer

Competitive salary and benefits package
Hybrid working model – typically 3 days per week in the Belfast office
Private healthcare, pension, and flexible working options
Opportunities for career progression within a global organisation
A culture that values innovation, collaboration, and professional development




This is a rare opportunity to join a leading cybersecurity powerhouse as it continues to expand its analytics and customer intelligence capabilities in Belfast. If you’re passionate about turning data into business impact, this could be the perfect next step in your career.

If you have any further questions about the role, please feel free to reach out to Eve Geddis directly on LinkedIn.

Title: Data Analyst - SQL and Tableau
Description:
Company Description

Radius is a global business services company operating in 19 countries across five continents. Founded in 1990, we’ve grown from a successful fuel card business in North West England into a trusted provider of fleet and connectivity solutions for businesses of all sizes.

Our mission is to help companies adapt to market changes and seize new opportunities through integrated, scalable services.

Job Description

We are seeking an experienced Data Analyst to join our central Data Services & Reporting (DS&R) team.

This role is ideal for a data professional with at least two years commercial experience using SQL and Tableau to deliver impactful insights across a diverse business.

You’ll collaborate with stakeholders across all eight divisions of Radius, helping to shape data-driven decisions and improve reporting processes.

While experience with Salesforce reporting is advantageous, it is not essential - we offer support and development in this area.

This is a fully office-based role, located at our Radius Campus HQ in Crewe, Cheshire.

Objectives


Deliver accurate, insightful reporting solutions through agile development and service desk support.
Promote adoption of automated, self-service reporting tools across the business.
Support the broader Radius Data Strategy through training, stakeholder engagement, and continuous improvement.
Work collaboratively to enhance team performance and drive innovation in reporting.


Key Responsibilities


Design and deliver reporting solutions using Tableau and SQL, aligned with business needs and team standards.
Engage directly with stakeholders to gather requirements, understand business processes, and manage small projects to support reporting delivery.
Support the Data Service Desk on a rota basis (2-4 hours per week), providing quick development fixes and guidance to business teams.
Collaborate with DS&R colleagues, IT, and Radius business units on larger, cross-functional data projects.
Contribute to team development, process improvement, and overall wellbeing within DS&R.


What We’re Looking For


Minimum of two years’ commercial experience in a data analyst role.
Strong SQL skills and a commitment to further development in data analytics.
Proven experience with Tableau.
Ability to work with stakeholders to refine requirements and deliver actionable insights.
Analytical mindset with attention to detail and a curiosity for understanding business context.
Familiarity with Salesforce dashboards and reporting is a plus, but not required.


Additional Information

Your impact on Radius will be rewarded with the opportunity to develop and progress your career in many directions.

You’ll also have access to our competitive reward and benefits package, which includes:


Pension
Life assurance
Performance-related bonus scheme
Employee fuel card scheme
Electric Vehicle scheme
Employee assistance programme
Wellness and healthcare assistance via ‘Help@Hand’ by Unum
‘Cycle to work’ scheme
Free breakfast daily in the office


And of course, you will be part of a modern purpose-built space in Crewe that will provide you with an outstanding working environment complete with gym, café, games rooms, and more!

Still Curious?

If you feel we are a good match for each other, you can apply online now!

If you’d like to understand more about the role or life at Radius before applying, then please contact our talent team via [email protected].

Radius is an equal opportunities employer. We are committed to welcome people regardless of age, disability, gender identity, race, faith or belief, sexual orientation or socioeconomic background.

We are committed to ensuring an inclusive and accessible recruitment process for all candidates. If you require any adjustments or accommodations at any stage of the process, please let us know, and we will do our best to support you.

We reserve the right to close a vacancy before the closing date in the event of an overwhelming response or a change in business priorities.

Note To Recruitment Agencies

We do not accept speculative recruitment agency CVs or profiles. Any unsolicited CV received by Radius will be treated as a gift and not eligible for an agency fee.

PSL agencies should only send CVs via our Applicant Tracking System, when approved to do so by the Radius Talent Team.

Title: Data Analyst
Place: City Of London, England, United Kingdom
Description:
Our Client is an exciting, fast-growing fintech start-up transforming how individuals and businesses manage their finances through data-driven insights and automation. As they continue to scale, they’re looking for a Data Analyst / Data Specialist to join their dynamic analytics team - someone who can turn complex data into clear, actionable insights that drive product and commercial decisions.




The Role

As a Data Analyst, you’ll play a key role in building scalable data models, uncovering meaningful trends, and providing strategic insights across product, marketing, and customer operations. You’ll work closely with cross-functional teams to design dashboards, optimise data pipelines, and support data-led decision-making across the business.




Key Responsibilities:

Gather, clean, and analyse large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and business opportunities.
Build and maintain robust data pipelines and reporting solutions.
Develop and automate dashboards (e.g., in Power BI, Tableau, or Looker) for internal stakeholders.
Work collaboratively with product, engineering, and finance teams to define and track KPIs.
Translate complex data into clear, business-friendly recommendations.
Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and governance across all analytics functions.




About You

You’re analytical, curious, and commercially minded - with a passion for problem-solving and continuous improvement. You bring both technical skill and storytelling ability, using data to drive smarter decisions.




Essential Skills & Experience:

2–5 years’ experience in a Data Analyst, Data Specialist, or BI role.
SQL skills and strong proficiency with Python (for data analysis and automation).
Proven experience working with data visualisation tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or Looker.
Familiarity with cloud data platforms (e.g. AWS Redshift, Google BigQuery, Snowflake).
Strong grounding in ETL / ELT processes, data modelling, and API data integration.
Experience with version control (Git) and collaborative environments.
Solid understanding of statistics and data storytelling principles.




Nice-to-Haves:

Exposure to fintech, financial services, or SaaS environments.
Familiarity with modern analytics stacks (e.g., dbt, Airflow, Databricks).
Experience using machine learning or predictive analytics tools.




Why Join Our Client?

Be part of a high-growth fintech with a mission to simplify and democratise financial data.
Collaborate with a talented, cross-functional team that values innovation and autonomy.
Hybrid working setup – modern London HQ with flexibility to work remotely.
Competitive compensation, equity options, and professional development opportunities.







If this role aligns with your experience and ambitions, please submit your application. Due to the high volume, we may not be able to contact all applicants individually. Shortlisted candidates can expect to hear from us within two weeks of applying.

Title: Graduate Data Analyst
Description:
Job Position: Graduate Data Analyst (Engineer/Scientist) - via the Graduate Development Programme 

Locations: Sheffield and South Yorkshire

Starting Salary: £25,000  

Application Requirements:


Minimum 2:1 or above in a STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, and Math) subject.
Experience in analysing data.
Right to work in the UK unsponsored for the duration of the programme.
Ability to work on site up to 5 days a week.


Grayce is not on the UK Border Agency's Sponsor Register and is unable to sponsor work visas for international applicants. 

Are you a curious, adaptable, and proactive problem solver with strong communication skills and a drive to make an impact? At Grayce, we're looking for ambitious graduates who are eager to learn, take ownership and build meaningful relationships while delivering excellence. If you have a keen attention to detail and accuracy, a knack for spotting trends and patterns and the ability to tell a compelling story using data, you'll thrive in our environment. We value resourcefulness, resilience, and a passion for driving change. Join us and be part of a community that cares, collaborates, and thrives together.

Understanding the types of roles available to a Data Analyst:

Data Analyst:

Kick-start your career as a Data Analyst, where you'll transform complex data into actionable insights, create dynamic visualisations and drive business decisions. You'll work with cutting-edge tools, collaborate with stakeholders, and develop automated reports and dashboards, all while refining your technical expertise and problem-solving skills in a fast-paced environment.

Data Engineer:

Launch your career as a Data Engineer, where you'll design and maintain data pipelines, integrate multiple data sources, and ensure data quality in a cloud-based environment. You'll write clean, testable code, automate data transformation processes, and collaborate with teams to build scalable, high-quality data solutions that drive business insights.

Data Scientist:

Working as a Data Scientist, you'll support quantitative research and management teams by delivering high-quality data models and exploratory analysis. You'll leverage your analytical skills to extract insights from complex datasets, build robust data pipelines, and collaborate across teams to drive data-driven initiatives that enhance data ecosystems.

Why Grayce?

We specialise in driving change and transformation for some of the world's most ambitious organisations and for over a decade, we've partnered with FTSE 100 and 250 companies to deliver impactful results by developing and deploying high-performing talent in the UK and beyond.

Our accelerated development programme is designed to launch the careers of recent graduates eager to make an impact. We offer a fast-track route to expertise, allowing you to gain hands-on experience with one of our impressive clients in a variety of flexible roles.

Opportunity: You'll embark on a journey of continuous learning, gaining industry-accredited qualifications, whilst getting hands-on experience, working full time on site directly with prestigious FTSE100, 250, and 500 organisations.

Delivery: Typically will work for one client, delivering high quality outcomes during your Grayce tenure. The skills required for exceptional client delivery include natural curiosity, proactivity, adaptability, effective communication and problem solving.

Mentoring: Thrive under the guidance of our experienced Delivery Managers and Technical Trainers. They'll be your go-to, offering support, insights and sharing experiences.

Progression: Starting as an Analyst with the potential for significant salary progression, you will pick up invaluable skills and complete a minimum of 6 industry recognised accreditations during your time on the development programme.

What makes a great Grayce Analyst?

2:1 Undergraduate Degree: An undergraduate degree with a minimum 2:1 within in a STEM field. A solid academic basis within data analysis and science through an additional MSc would be an advantage.

Data Tools: Previous experience with tools such as Excel, R, SQL or Python are an essential for this role. If you have utilised visualisation programmes such as Tableau or Power BI in projects before, we are also keen to hear from you.

Analytical Problem Solving: We're looking for analytical minds that can spot patterns and think creatively. Whether it's dissecting complex issues or finding fresh angles, we highly value critical thinking skills and their application.

Soft Skills: From effective communication styles to planning, organisation and a learning development mindset, Grayce is committed to building core consultancy skills. Stakeholder and time management are core skills we utilise every day and we look for examples of those through our interview process.

Why work for us?

Competitive Salary: Starting at £25,000 with potential for significant growth

Industry Recognition: We help you embark on your journey with fully funded, industry-recognised qualifications designed to maximise your experience and put you in control of your career

Mentors and Coaches: Access a network of mentors and coaches dedicated to you, your experiences and development at Grayce

Wellness Support: We are here for you 24/7 with our Employee Assistance Programme, offering confidential assistance ranging from financial and legal support to health and wellbeing.
Show more

Description:

Title: BI & Data Analyst
Description:
As a partner to businesses and governments, Crane Authentication offers expertise and cutting-edge innovations that protect and enhance products, secure identities, safeguard revenues and enforce compliance. Customers from different business sectors and levels of government trust our team of 1,250 people for their expertise in R&D, security design, engineering and data-driven insights. We are an integral part of Crane NXT, a $2 billion dollar business with over 5,000 associates




Position Summary & Objective

The BI & Data Analyst is responsible for collecting, analyzing, and presenting data to support decision-making across the organization. This role develops and maintains reporting solutions, dashboards, and KPIs, ensuring data accuracy, consistency and is compliant with data governance principles. The Analyst works closely with internal/external stakeholders to understand requirements and deliver actionable insights, helping the organization monitor performance and identify opportunities for improvement.




Essential Functions Performedby the Position

Design, develop, and maintain regular reports and dashboards to support functions across the organization (creating prototypes where practicable)
Gather and document reporting requirements from business stakeholders; proactively challenge data owners/data users as appropriate and support them during testing
Ensure data accuracy, integrity, and consistency across solutions developed within the team
Perform data analysis to identify trends, risks, and opportunities
Automate all regular reporting deliverables, minimizing manual interventions and improving both quality and team efficiency
Support data governance principles and quality improvement initiatives (sharing data quality reporting concerns with data owners as necessary)
Work towards the introduction of risk-based data quality metric reporting
Conduct ad-hoc analysis to answer specific business questions
Build strong relationships with key stakeholders, providing training and support to end-users on BI and reporting tools
Prepare data presentations for management and senior leadership
Mentor junior team members as required
Work with colleagues to improve data pipelines and system integrations




Disclaimer

This job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties, or responsibilities that are required of the employee. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change, or new ones may be assigned at any time with or without notice.




Position Qualifications Education:

Educated to degree level with 5+ years’ work experience




Experience:

2–4 years of experience in MI, data analysis, or BI reporting
Proficiency with BI tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or Qlik, preferably Power BI
Strong SQL skills with an ability to query and transform data
Experience with Excel (advanced functions, pivot tables, macros)
Delivery and improvement of data, management information and business intelligence reporting
Exposure to data warehouses, ETL processes, or cloud data platforms a plus
Exposure to data governance principles and techniques to protect the use of data delivered by the team




Certifications/Licenses:

None required.
Advantageous: Data Analysis / Power BI accreditations or equivalent




Language Proficiency:

Fluent in English




Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities

Passion for data
Strong analytical and quantitative skills
Problem solver with an ability to translate data into clear, actionable insights
Collaborator with excellent communication and presentation skills
Focused with a high attention to detail and data accuracy
Supportive, reliable, productive, dependable and diligent
Adaptable, flexible and resilient with an ability to manage multiple reporting requests and deadlines
Familiarity with data governance and compliance best practices




Working Hours and Conditions

Office and Remote Work Environment
Collaboration across business functions and time zones




WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU?




Work for a market leading, established product company.
Nice modern offices with great facilities.
Health Insurance.
24 days holidays plus national holidays.
Life Insurance.




Crane Authentication is part of Crane NXT

Crane NXT is a premier industrial technology company that provides proprietary and trusted technology solutions to secure, detect, and authenticate what matters most to its customers. Crane NXT has approximately 5,000 employees with global operations and manufacturing facilities in the United States, the United Kingdom, Mexico, Japan, Switzerland, Germany, Sweden, and Malta. For more information, visit www.cranenxt.com.




We value diversity at our company. Everyone who applies with the qualifications will receive consideration for employment without regard to: age, colour, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

We receive a high number of applications, so apologies if we are unable to provide specific feedback. If we feel you are a fit for the role, we’ll be in contact.

Analytical Problem Solving: We're looking for analytical minds that can spot patterns and think creatively. Whether it's dissecting complex issues or finding fresh angles, we highly value critical thinking skills and their application.

Soft Skills: From effective communication styles to planning, organisation and a learning development mindset, Grayce is committed to building core consultancy skills. Stakeholder and time management are core skills we utilise every day and we look for examples of those through our interview process.

Why work for us?

Competitive Salary: Starting at £25,000 with potential for significant growth

Industry Recognition: We help you embark on your journey with fully funded, industry-recognised qualifications designed to maximise your experience and put you in control of your career

Mentors and Coaches: Access a network of mentors and coaches dedicated to you, your experiences and development at Grayce

Wellness Support: We are here for you 24/7 with our Employee Assistance Programme, offering confidential assistance ranging from financial and legal support to health and wellbeing.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Do you enjoy working with data?

Are you a problem solver?




About our Team: LexisNexis is a data and analytics company with 10,500 colleagues serving customers in more than 150 countries. We’re one of the largest information and analytics companies on the planet. We design solutions that help our customers increase productivity, improve decision-making and outcomes, and be more successful.




About the Role: As a Data Analyst III you will consult with internal stakeholders to understand problems, collect and analyze data to support data driven business decisions. This role uses data tools to collate, model, interpret, develop visualizations/information products, and communicate to the business. Specifically, individuals in this role will execute on projects/initiatives with high complexity independently.




Responsibilities:

Have an understanding of best practices
Execute on projects and initiatives independently
Providing support to the analytics team members
Leading analytics effort with high complexity
Collaborating with stakeholders to understand their business needs and to make suggestions for analysis and metrics to drive insights and recommendations
Understanding who the customers are and what is happening in the market with necessary commercial awareness
Creating visual displays of data through selected tools and analytical packages
Effectively lead and manage small/operational analytics projects




Requirements:

Bachelors or Master Degree in Data Analytics/Math or equivalent work experience
Ability to understand complex data structure and to apply advanced blending and refinement techniques including big data and knows how to apply advanced data preparation and refinement techniques
Significant experience leveraging SQL and Python for data querying
Experience with different visualizations tools such as Tableau or PowerBI
Experience in intermediate statistics
Have knowledge of big data platforms
Ability to present complex issues in simple and sophisticated insights
Ability to combine visualizations from multiple sources to tell an effective and engaging story
Knowledge of different project management approaches and lifecycles




Work in a way that works for you

We promote a healthy work/life balance across the organisation. We offer an appealing working prospect for our people. With numerous wellbeing initiatives, shared parental leave, study assistance and sabbaticals, we will help you meet your immediate responsibilities and your long-term goals.

Working flexible hours - flexing the times when you work in the day to help you fit everything in and work when you are the most productive




Working for you

We know that your wellbeing and happiness are key to a long and successful career. These are some of the benefits we are delighted to offer:

Generous holiday allowance with the option to buy additional days
Health screening, eye care vouchers and private medical benefits
Wellbeing programs
Life assurance
Access to a competitive contributory pension scheme
Save As You Earn share option scheme
Travel Season ticket loan
Electric Vehicle Scheme
Optional Dental Insurance
Maternity, paternity and shared parental leave
Employee Assistance Programme
Access to emergency care for both the elderly and children
RECARES days, giving you time to support the charities and causes that matter to you
Access to employee resource groups with dedicated time to volunteer
Access to extensive learning and development resources
Access to employee discounts scheme via Perks at Work




About the Business

LexisNexis Legal & Professional are a leading global provider of legal and regulatory intelligence. We give organisations the business information and analytics they need to make better, more impactful decisions. We are building powerful new decision tools that use machine learning, natural language processing, visualisation and artificial intelligence that aid and enhance decision making.

Show more

Title: Business Data Analyst, Reporting
Description:
Company




Founded in 1926 by Marcel Bleustein-Blanchet, today Publicis Groupe is the second largest communications group in the world and a leader in marketing, communication, and digital business transformation, led by Arthur Sadoun, the third CEO in its history. Publicis Groupe is positioned at every step of the value chain, from consulting to execution, combining marketing transformation and digital business transformation.




Publicis Groupe is a privileged partner in its clients’ transformation to enhance personalisation at scale. The Groupe relies on ten expertise concentrated within four main activities: Communication, Media, Data and Technology. Through a unified and fluid organisation, its clients have a facilitated access to all its expertise in every market. Present in over 100 countries, Publicis Groupe employs around 103,000 professionals.




Overview




At Publicis Groupe, we believe in the power of data to transform how brands connect with people. Our Data Solutions team leads a Groupe-wide initiative focused on delivering best-in-class reporting and data solutions for some of the world’s most iconic brands. We work hand-in-hand with client teams, analysts, and tech specialists to build scalable, intelligent reporting frameworks that drive insight and action.




We’re now looking for a Business Data Analyst, Reporting to join our growing team and help bridge the gap between business and tech. If you thrive at the intersection of analytics, systems thinking, and client service—this role is for you.




Responsibilities




As a Business Data Analyst, Reporting you’ll serve as the strategic link between client-facing teams and our technical developers—translating complex requirements into clear, deliverable solutions. Your focus will span data integrations, API connectors, reporting development, and dashboard functionality. Expect to lead projects end-to-end, working across teams to deliver smart, scalable, and elegant data solutions.




Client & Stakeholder Leadership

Be a trusted partner to internal client teams, ensuring expectations are met with clear timelines, technical support, and transparent communication
Lead regular check-ins to align on goals, capture feedback, and proactively surface new needs
Maintain a detailed understanding of project status and ensure best-in-class service delivery




Data Integration & Testing

Own the setup and maintenance of API connectors and automated reporting pipelines
Validate data quality, perform regression testing, and ensure KPI definitions match client narratives
Collaborate with technical teams to guarantee dashboard integrity and address any discrepancies




Reporting & Dashboard Development

Create dashboard wireframes, gather input from client teams, and translate into development-ready briefs
Oversee QA processes with Data Governance and the BI team
Coordinate testing, troubleshooting, and resolution of reporting issues
Safely manage data sharing with non-Publicis users in line with security standards




Qualifications




✔ Experience in a data, operations, or analytics-focused role

✔ Familiarity with BI and reporting platforms such as Power BI, Datorama, Data Studio, Databricks, SQL

✔ Strong communication skills and a collaborative, solutions-focused mindset

✔ An organised, proactive approach—comfortable working across teams and timelines

✔ Excitement for new technology, data storytelling, and digital marketing innovation

✔ A team player who’s passionate about making data work harder, smarter, and more creatively




Benefits:




In The UK, Alongside The Core Benefits Such As Pension, Life Assurance, Private Medical, And Income Protection Plan, We Also Offer:




WORK YOUR WORLD opportunity to work anywhere in the world, where there is a Publicis office, for up to 6 weeks a year.
REFLECTION DAYS - Two additional days of paid leave to step away from your usual day-to-day work and create time to focus on your well-being and self-care.
HELP@HAND BENEFITS 24/7 helpline to support you on a personal and professional level. Access to remote GPs, mental health support and CBT. Wellbeing content and lifestyle coaching.
FAMILY FRIENDLY POLICIES We provide 26 weeks of full pay for the following family milestones: Maternity. Adoption, Surrogacy and Shared Parental Leave.
FLEXIBLE WORKING, BANK HOLIDAY SWAP & BIRTHDAY DAY OFF You are entitled to an additional day off for your birthday, from your first day of employment.
GREAT LOCAL DISCOUNTS This includes membership discounts with Soho Friends, local restaurants and retailers in Westfield White City and Television Centre.




Publicis Groupe operates a hybrid working pattern with full time employees being office-based three days during the working week.

Show more

Publicis Groupe operates a hybrid working pattern with full time employees being office-based three days during the working week.

Title: Data Analyst - Digital Asset
Description:
Our Client is Hiring: Data Analyst (Python | Quant | Digital Assets)




Are you a Data Analyst, Index Analyst, or Quantitative Analyst with strong Python skills and an interest in digital assets? This is your chance to join a globally recognised index provider at the cutting edge of benchmark innovation - working across design, methodology, and operations for next-generation digital asset indices.




What You’ll Do:

Run and oversee validation models to ensure index accuracy and integrity
Perform index reconstitutions using Python and related tools
Prepare and distribute index announcements to stakeholders
Set up, test, and deploy new indices and reference rates
Maintain and enhance index calculation and weighting models
Collaborate with engineers to define requirements and test new releases
Handle client inquiries, lead calls, and provide methodological insights
Review and update index methodologies; present recommendations internally
Troubleshoot issues, monitor system alerts, and lead remediation efforts
Document operational processes and improve workflows for efficiency and control




What We’re Looking For:

2+ years’ experience as a Data Analyst, Index Analyst, or similar role
Strong Python skills; comfortable building models and data pipelines
Good understanding of statistics, maths, and quantitative methods
Hands-on experience with large, time-series financial datasets
Knowledge of financial markets and derivatives; digital asset exposure a plus
Proficiency in Excel; APIs/streaming data experience an advantage
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail
Excellent project management and cross-functional collaboration skills




Why Join?

Shape the future of digital asset benchmarks at a leading index provider
Work at the intersection of finance, technology, and quantitative research
Central London base with hybrid flexibility
Salary £60,000 – £70,000




**This role will begin as a 12-month fixed-term contract, with potential to convert to permanent afterwards**

Show more

Title: Data Analyst SQL (Pricing)
Description:
Are you ready to write your next chapter?

Make your mark at one of the biggest names in payments. We’re looking for a Senior Data Analyst to join our ever-evolving Merchant Revenue Operations team and help us unleash the potential of every business.

About The Team

We’re looking for a Senior Data Analyst to join our global team. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to provide detailed data and trend analysis to support our pricing strategy for Merchants.

To learn more about our winning teams, check out our world-class teams that own it every day.

What You’ll Own As The Senior Data Analyst


Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand reporting requirements and gather data to develop insights.
Design and implement advanced SQL queries to extract, manipulate, and analyse data from various sources.
Assists business analysts with finding patterns and relationships in data.
Develop and maintain interactive dashboards, ensuring data is presented visually clearly and effectively.
Create, present and review summary KPIs and dashboards with Senior Leadership to help provide business guidance and support
Manage a portfolio of Merchants in reviewing and support Re-pricing models.
Collaborate with peers and mentor others to help enhance business and technical tools knowledge across the team


What You’ll Bring


5+ years of experience in data analysis and reporting, preferably in a corporate environment.
Advanced Excel and strong proficiency in SQL.
Excellent organisational and communication skills, with the ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment
Statistical Analysis: Good knowledge of statistical concepts and methodologies to support data-driven insights.
Strong analytical skills with a problem-solving mindset and attention to detail.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present complex information clearly to non-technical stakeholders.
Experience working with large datasets and knowledge of database management systems.


It’s a Bonus If You Have


Experience with using software packages such as R or Python to solve problems
Experience with visualization tools Power BI or Tableau
Payment’s background


What Makes a Worldpayer

What makes a Worldpayer? It’s simple: Think, Act, Win. We stay curious, always asking the right questions and finding creative solutions to simplify the complex. We’re dynamic, every Worldpayer is empowered to make the right decisions for their customers. And we’re determined, always staying open and winning and failing as one.

Does this sound like you? Then you sound like a Worldpayer. Apply now to write the next chapter in your career.

#IND2025

Privacy Statement

Worldpay is committed to protecting the privacy and security of all personal information that we process in order to provide services to our clients. For specific information on how Worldpay protects personal information online, please see the Online Privacy Notice.

Sourcing Model

Recruitment at Worldpay works primarily on a direct sourcing model; a relatively small portion of our hiring is through recruitment agencies. Worldpay does not accept resumes from recruitment agencies which are not on the preferred supplier list and is not responsible for any related fees for resumes submitted to job postings, our employees, or any other part of our company.

#pridepass

Title: Quantitative Researcher
Description:
Fuse Energy is a forward-thinking renewable energy startup on a mission to deliver a terawatt of renewable energy - fast. We're combining first-principles thinking with cutting-edge technology to build a radically better energy system. We raised $100M from top-tier investors including Multicoin, Balderton, Lakestar, Accel, Creandum, Lowercarbon, Ribbit, Box Group and strategic angels like Nico Rosberg, the Co-Founder of Solana and GPs behind Meta, Revolut, Spotify, Uber and more.

We're creating a fully integrated energy company: from developing solar, wind and hydrogen projects to real-time power trading and distributed energy installations. By selling directly to consumers, we cut out the middleman, lower costs and pass on savings to customers.

But we're not stopping there. We're also building the Energy Network: a decentralised platform of smart devices that rewards users in Energy Dollars for electrifying their homes, shifting usage to off-peak hours, and helping balance the grid. This network strengthens grid stability - a critical foundation for scaling AI data centers and other energy-intensive industries.

Responsibilities


Develop and implement quantitative models to support hedging strategies for retail energy supply
Analyze market data to optimize the performance of physical assets such as solar and wind farms
Conduct statistical and scenario-based modeling to inform trading and risk management decisions
Monitor power markets, pricing trends, and regulatory developments to identify risks and opportunities
Collaborate with engineering and operations teams to integrate models into day-to-day decision-making


Requirements


1+ years of experience in quantitative modeling, data analysis, or a related role in energy, trading, or analytics
Strong proficiency in Python, with experience using libraries for data analysis, modeling, and visualization
Solid understanding of statistical modeling, optimization, and analysis techniques
Experience working with time series or market data, preferably in energy or commodities markets
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights


Benefits


Competitive salary and an equity sign-on bonus
Biannual bonus scheme
Fully expensed tech to match your needs
Paid annual leave
Breakfast and dinner for office based employees
Show more

Title: Data Analyst Intern
Description:
About Pimlico Enterprises

Pimlico Enterprises helps organizations make smarter business decisions using the power of data. We specialize in analytics consulting, helping clients transform raw information into actionable insights.

We are now hiring Data Analyst Interns who are passionate about data and eager to grow their technical and analytical skills through hands-on experience.




Role Overview

As a Data Analyst Intern, you will work closely with our analytics and consulting teams to support real client projects. This internship provides practical experience with tools like Excel, SQL, and Power BI, and offers structured mentorship to help you build a strong foundation in data analytics.




Key Responsibilities
Collect, clean, and validate datasets from multiple sources.
Support the creation of dashboards and reports using Power BI or Excel.
Write and run basic SQL queries for analysis.
Perform exploratory data analysis (EDA) to identify insights and trends.
Summarize findings into clear business reports and visualizations.
Participate in team meetings and contribute ideas to analytical solutions.




Candidate Profile

We’re looking for individuals who are analytical, curious, and eager to learn. While prior experience isn’t required, a solid foundation in analytical thinking and data tools is desirable.




Essential Skills:

Strong Excel skills (formulas, pivot tables, data cleaning).
Basic understanding of data analysis principles.
Excellent written and verbal communication.
Ability to work independently and as part of a remote team.




Desirable Skills (Not Mandatory):

Familiarity with SQL and data visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau).
Exposure to Python, R, or statistical methods.




What We Offer
Paid internship (£1,800–£2,500 per month).
Fully remote, flexible work environment (UK-based applicants only).
Mentorship and guidance from senior analysts.
28 days of annual leave plus UK bank holidays.
Performance-based bonuses.
Access to mental health and wellbeing support.




Eligibility

Applicants must have the legal right to work in the UK. Unfortunately, we cannot provide visa sponsorship at this time.




Our Hiring Process
Introductory Call – Informal discussion to understand your goals.
Interview – Deeper conversation about your skills and interests.
Technical Task – Short assignment to assess analytical ability.

We value transparency and will guide you through each step of the process.




Diversity & Inclusion

At Pimlico Enterprises, we are proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. We welcome applications from all backgrounds and are happy to make reasonable adjustments during the hiring process.




Industry: Business Consulting and Services

Seniority Level: Internship

Employment Type: Part-time (Remote, London Only)
